snippet: When patients go to a hospital in Greece, they often must hire their own nurses just to receive basic care, and many of those nurses are untrained and illegal.
abstract: Many patients at Greek hospitals must resort to employing illegal nurses, many of whom are untrained immigrants, as austerity measures have gutted health care system and thinned ranks of qualified nurses; nurses are but one hospital amenity that can be rented by patients and their families, and indicate both the way Greek's black-market economy functions and how decline in living standards spurred anti-austerity Syriza Party to victory.
lead_paragraph: When patients go to a hospital in Greece, they often must hire their own nurses just to receive basic care, and many of those nurses are untrained and illegal.

headline.main: Greek Austerity Spawns Fakery: Playing Nurse
headline.print_headline: Greek Austerity Spawns Fakery: Playing Nurse
